JFORTES's Tutorial
===================================

JFORTES aims to extract the safety properties generated by ESC/JAVA [#f1]_ to generate automatically
test cases using the rich set of assertions provided by Unit Test frameworks.




Requirements for using the tool
-----------------------------------

To use this tool is necessary that the system contains the following software already installed properly:

- Python
- ESC/JAVA [#f1]_
- Java 1.5 [#f2]_
- Ctags [#f3]_


WARNNING: ESC/Java2 is written with Java 1.4 and only runs in a Java 1.4 or 1.5 virtual machine.
While ESC/Java2 should work in any Java 1.4 or 1.5 virtual machine.


How to install JFortes?
-----------------------------------

In order to install JFortes on your PC, you should download and save the JFORTES_vx.zip file on your disk.
After that, you should type the following command:

STEP 1:
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

    $ tar -xzvf JFORTES_vx.zip

or from GITHUB

.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

    $ git clone https://github.com/hbgit/jfortes.git



STEP 2:
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Open the directory where the JFortes tool was extracted and then you should locate the configure.py script.
After that, you should run the configure.py script, it is worth to say that you should run the configure.py script
from inside the directory where JFortes was extracted.

.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

    $ cd JFortes_vx
    $ ls
    $ ./configure.py


Now it is advisable that you should set the environment variable PATH in your .bashrc for:

- Java 5

.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

    # --- Java 5
    $ JAVA_HOME="/usr/lib/java/jdk1.5.0_22/"
    $ export JAVA_HOME
    $ export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH

- ESC/JAVA

.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

    export PATH=$PATH:/home/hrocha/Downloads/ESCJava-2.0.5-04-11-08-binary/


STEP 3:
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

It is advisable that you should set the environment variable PATH in your .bashrc file as follows:

.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

        $ export PATH=$PATH:/home/user/JFortes_vx/

STEP 4:
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Testing Map2Check-Fortes

.. highlight:: BashLexer
.. code-block:: bash

        $ jfortes.py test_cases/primary_tests/Bag.java
